intro: Tarrietia erythrosiphon, commonly known as the red-siphon tarrietia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
